intro: Hieracium kjellandii, commonly known as the Kjelland's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Scandinavia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils. It has basal leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Hieracium kjellandii is a perennial herb that produces small yellow flowers from June to August.
